speaker: Frasier
text: Brian, let me assure you. No one is a born scatterbrain! You simply have to develop your powers of concentration. On a trip to the Amazon I was able to observe the hunters of the primitive Shipibo tribe. With nothing more than a crude blowgun they can bring down small monkeys from the forest canopy high above their heads. How? Focus�..  [_Someone comes into Roz's booth and hands her a sheet of paper while Frasier continues_]

speaker: Frasier
text: �..and mental discipline and that's what we have to work on Brian. Focus on one thing and not allow ourselves to be distracted by a single�..  [_Roz rushes in excited and shows Frasier the piece of paper_]

speaker: Frasier
text: WE'VE BEEN NOMINATED FOR A SEABEA!!!  [_Frasier and Roz jump up and down in excitement before realising the problems of the last caller and that he is still on the line_]

speaker: Frasier
text: Of course we should never become so single-minded that we don't allow ourselves to be spontaneous. We'll be back right after this.  [_Frasier goes to a commercial break_]

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh Roz. This is wonderful. They like me, they really like me.

speaker: Roz
text: Oh my God I have to lose five pounds in two weeks

speaker: Frasier
text: [_taking the bar of chocolate that Roz is eating out of her hands_] Well that'll be enough of that! [_Frasier goes to open his briefcase and takes out a red rose_]

speaker: Frasier
text: Roz. Listen I bought this for you this morning and I was hoping that I wouldn't have to say this was just for being you.

speaker: Roz
text: Oh thanks Frasier. This is so great. You know last year I was so obsessed with winning that I didn't even enjoy being nominated. But this year I don't care if we win or lose. I'm just gonna buy myself a beautiful dress and have my hair done and I'm gonna stretch out in the back of a limo with my date�.

speaker: Frasier
text: �..and wonder why you bothered having your hair done!  [_Bulldog rushes in and grabs Frasier_]

speaker: Bulldog
text: Hey Doc. Congratulations! Hey Roz�. [_Sees Roz is not too impressed so doesn't grab her_]

speaker: Frasier
text: Well I understand congratulations are in order for you as well Bulldog. What is this now? Four nominations? Three wins?

speaker: Bulldog
text: Yeah. I've been a symbol of broadcasting excellence in Seattle since 1991.  [_Bulldog starts sniffing the air before barking and stamping his feet at a woman outside_]

speaker: Bulldog
text: See ya Doc.

speaker: Roz
text: Thirty seconds.

speaker: Frasier
text: Thank you Roz. Whom do we have?

speaker: Roz
text: On line one we have a shoplifter from Bainbridge and then line two is your number one fan.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh Kari.

speaker: Roz
text: Mmm-hmm, for the fourth time this week. Why don't you let me get rid of her? All she ever does is gush and tell you how wonderful you are.

speaker: Frasier
text: And this hurts me how? [_Frasier starts the show again_]

speaker: Frasier
text: Hello Seattle we're back. Got time for just one more call so Roz -- who do we have on the line?

speaker: Roz
text: Oh please!

speaker: Frasier
text: Hello. You're on with Frasier Crane.

speaker: Kari
text: Hi Dr. Crane. It's me Kari. Nervous as usual. Anyway I hope you're not getting sick of me. I just think you're wonderful. Thank you for always talking to me.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well thank you for being so sweet.

speaker: Kari
text: Well thank you for giving such good advice.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well thank you for being�. [_Roz knock violently on the glass for Frasier to wrap it up_]

speaker: Frasier
text: If that's all?

speaker: Kari
text: That was a beautiful rose you bought this morning.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes I bought it to give to�[_look of confusion on Frasier's face_]�.excuse me?

speaker: Kari
text: Don't be surprised. I saw you at the florists. You weren't doing your regular routine.

speaker: Frasier
text: My regular routine?

speaker: Kari
text: Cafe Nervosa. You go there every morning. Except today. I can tell I'm boring you now. Bye!

speaker: Frasier
text: Well goodbye Kari. Well that's all our time for today Seattle. Goodbye and good listening. [_Frasier signs off. Roz comes into the booth_]

speaker: Roz
text: That was pretty weird. Now she's following you?

speaker: Frasier
text: I don't think it's so weird. It's hardly following. Maybe she hangs out at Cafe Nervosa too and the florist is right next door.

speaker: Roz
text: Well be careful out there. There's a lot of creeps.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh Roz I hate that word "creeps". There's a lot of odd people in this business. I never refer to any of them as a "creep". [_Bulldog comes into the booth_]

speaker: Bulldog
text: Hey Roz will you stop wearing those corduroys? I can't see your pantyline. [_Roz looks at Frasier who rolls his eyes_]

speaker: Frasier
text: Although some people do send me groping for synonyms. _Scene 2 -- Frasier's Apartment _ **GETTING A BIT LOOPY**  [_Frasier and Niles walk in to see Daphne sitting at the table_]

speaker: Frasier
text: Ah, what are you up to?

speaker: Daphne
text: I just measured your Father for his tuxedo.

speaker: Niles
text: Oh Frasier that reminds me. I'm afraid Maris won't be able to make your SeaBea awards tomorrow night.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well I can hardly be surprised. Any particular reason?

speaker: Niles
text: Yes! And this time it's a good one. She's very upset about her manicurist. The woman's being doing Maris' nails for years now and sadly she was just taken critically ill.

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh dear. How bad is she?

speaker: Niles
text: She'll be fine once she finds another manicurist! Until then she's curtailing all public appearances.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, well I'm sorry. It's not like I'm nominated for a SeaBea every year. Oh wait a minute -- yes it is!

speaker: Niles
text: Well as some illustrious person once said, "popularity is the hallmark of mediocrity"

speaker: Frasier
text: You just made that up didn't you?

speaker: Niles
text: Yes, but I stand by it.

speaker: Daphne
text: Will you be joining us for dinner tonight Dr. Crane.

speaker: Niles
text: No. Frasier and I are going to the opera. We're seeing "Der fliegende Hollander". [_pointing towards Frasier_] Oh don't forget -- the tickets are in your briefcase. I can hear that first aria already [_starts humming the tune_]

speaker: Martin
text: Don't Niles. You'll start singing it then I'll start singing it and I won't be able to get it out of my head. [_Frasier opens his briefcase and finds a scarf inside_]

speaker: Frasier
text: What's this? [_reads the label_] "Dear Dr. Crane. A little bit of me to wrap around your neck. Your number one fan. Kari"

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh how sweet. Your fan knitted you a scarf.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, but when did she find the time to put it in my briefcase. I haven't had it out of my hand all day except when I was in the barber's chair.

speaker: Martin
text: Hell, that didn't give her more than thirty seconds!

speaker: Niles
text: [_examining the label_] So you're saying this woman followed you into the barber shop then slipped a scarf into your briefcase.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well she's a very devoted fan.

speaker: Niles
text: She has the handwriting of a sociopath.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh she does not.

speaker: Niles
text: [_holding up the label_] Big loops

speaker: Daphne
text: That's exactly how Scotland Yard caught "The Butcher of Brighton". He used big loops -- a clear sign of anger. And he crossed his t's in a downward stroke indicating aggression. Of course he also kept a demister saucer full of eyelids on his night table. [_Daphne leaves the room_]

speaker: Frasier
text: Anybody here besides me think we should put a two-way lock on her door?

speaker: Martin
text: Well if you ask me it's probably nothing but there are some weirdo's out there so just keep your eyes open.

speaker: Frasier
text: Dad, she's not a weirdo. She's just a woman who finds me utterly fascinating

speaker: Niles
text: And the distinction would be?

speaker: Frasier
text: In any case, I do think that her invading my space is inappropriate. I hardly think we should start barricading the door.

speaker: Niles
text: Let's review. She started with calls to the station then moved onto spying on you. Now she's been in your briefcase. It's the classic progression of the predator stalking its prey in ever-narrowing circles, or "loops". That's for you Daphne.

speaker: Daphne
text: [_looks up and smiles_] Thank you. [_The doorbell rings and Frasier goes to answer_]

speaker: Frasier
text: Niles, you make me sound like a goat staked out in a clearing. No one is hunting me down. No one is closing in on me. [_Frasier opens the door to find a large number of balloons floating outside_]

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh. Look. These must be from the station [_examines the card_] "From your number one fan Kari. Your time has come. You're finally going to get what you deserve."

speaker: Niles
text: The loop tightens!

speaker: Frasier
text: Stop it Niles. She's probably just referring to the fact that it's time I win this award. Try as you will you are not going to turn me into some sort of a nervous wreck. [_Frasier goes to bring the balloons inside but accidentally bursts one of them causing him to reel back in surprised fear_]

speaker: Frasier
text: It's just not going to happen! **KRAKATOA, WEST OF JAVA (THE MOVIE WAS WRONG)**  [_Frasier is speaking to one of his callers_]

speaker: Caller
text: I don't understand it Doc. I'm a successful guy. I have my own car dealership but still I'm depressed. You've probably heard of me -- Madman Martinez.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well what seems to be the source of your depression Madman?

speaker: Caller
text: I guess it's just that business is down. I don't know why. I slashed prices this week. Right now I got an '88 old Cutlass on the lot in rare turquoise metallic, Cordoba roof, leather, factory year�.

speaker: Frasier
text: Madman.

speaker: Caller
text: [_voice getting increasingly louder and excited_]�..and that's nothing compared to the six brand new Super's I got in. Their prices�.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_becoming increasingly annoyed_] Maybe�

speaker: Caller
text: �20% discount to all your listeners. People say to me "Madman you're crazy". I say, "HEY, I DEAL IN VOLUME!"

speaker: Frasier
text: [_turning the volume down on the line_] Fortunately, so do I. Well that's about all the time we have today folks. Stay tuned for Bob "Bulldog" Briscoe after these paid commercial messages.  [_Frasier signs off and goes into Roz's booth. Roz is sitting there trying to hide her face_]

speaker: Frasier
text: Roz, what is the matter with you? You're supposed to be screening these calls!

speaker: Roz
text: Just dowse me in gasoline and toss me a match.

speaker: Frasier
text: I was hoping a stern warning would do the trick.  [_Roz turns around to reveal a huge red mark on her nose. Frasier looks in horror_]

speaker: Roz
text: I'm talking about this. Three hours until the limo picks me up for the SeaBea's and my nose erupts like Krakatoa!

speaker: Frasier
text: It's barely noticeable.

speaker: Roz
text: From where? The Space Shuttle? Vintage Roz or what? I finally lose five pounds and I gain three of it back on my nose!

speaker: Frasier
text: Roz, I'm sure that with enough foundation and some contouring, maybe a little shadowing [_realises he is fighting a lost cause_] Have you considered wearing a beekeeper's mask?

speaker: Roz
text: Do I make fun of that Astrodome you call a forehead?

speaker: Frasier
text: Gee Roz. It's been sort of a tough week for me too, you know? Kari has taken to putting notes in my briefcase. She's even been to my apartment.

speaker: Roz
text: Frasier, you've got to do something. Don't you remember "Leo the Happy Chef"? He had an obsessed fan too. It started out innocently just like yours and she ended up breaking into his house.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes I understand she bent his whisk and scratched all his Teflon!

speaker: Roz
text: Make fun all you want but she made his life miserable and she didn't quit until he hired himself a bodyguard. Want me to find out who he is?

speaker: Frasier
text: No, no, no. I have a hard time believing that Kari poses a real threat. I mean she doesn't even have the nerve to come up and look at me face to face. Lord knows she's had the opportunity.

speaker: Roz
text: Well suit yourself. If you ask me the woman is acting very weird.  [_Roz takes out a teabag and puts it on her nose_]

speaker: Frasier
text: Tea good for your nose?

speaker: Roz
text: [_sarcastic_] No I finally found a bag to match my shoes!

speaker: Frasier
text: Roz, you're dripping all over the console  [_Frasier takes a handkerchief out his pocket to wipe up and a small card falls out as well, which Frasier examines_]

speaker: Frasier
text: Kari?

speaker: Roz
text: Again? How did she get in your jacket?

speaker: Frasier
text: I have no idea. [_reading the card_] "I'm very disappointed in you Dr. Crane. You didn't wear the scarf I knitted you even though it was very cold. The last man who disappointed me that way��is in his grave. PS -- I'll be at the awards tonight and I'll be looking for you. Your number one fan Kari."

speaker: Roz
text: Oh great. I'm sitting at your table with a bullseye on my nose! _Act 2 Scene 1 -- Frasier's Apartment _ **SOMEONE TO WATCH OVER ME**  [_Frasier, Daphne and Martin are all dressed ready for the SeaBea's. Frasier is pacing the floor_]

speaker: Daphne
text: Now, now, Dr. Crane you've really got to try to relax.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh you're right Daphne. After all what do I have to be nervous about? I'm only up for a major award. If I lose I'll be devastated. If I win then a mad woman who's been stalking me will have a clear shot when I accept!

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh don't worry about it so. That's what you hired a bodyguard for.

speaker: Martin
text: I still don't see why. Most likely nothing's gonna happen and even if it does I was a cop for thirty years. This whole thing's a waste of money.

speaker: Frasier
text: Dad, there's a big difference between a policeman and a skilled bodyguard. These people are trained to size up a crowd, plan escape routes, even get shot if necessary.

speaker: Martin
text: Hey I know how to take a bullet.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh yes that's just what your personality needs -- another bullet!  [_The doorbell goes_]

speaker: Frasier
text: That must be him. Who is it please?

speaker: Niles
text: Lizzie Borden. I want you to autograph my hatchet. [_Frasier open the door to a smug Niles_]

speaker: Frasier
text: That's not very funny.

speaker: Niles
text: Everyone ready to go?

speaker: Martin
text: Nah, we're still waiting for his rent-a-goon.

speaker: Frasier
text: Apparently he's stuck in traffic.

speaker: Niles
text: Perhaps your admirer ran into him first and he's stuffed in some janitor's closet, his purple bloated tongue protruding above his freshly garrotted neck. Is that champagne?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, you're a fountain of comfort this evening.

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, I'm just teasing. If you must know I'm a little jealous. I told Maris about your troubles. All she does is sulk and talk about bodyguards. "Why don't we need one?" "Aren't we important enough to be stalked?" I have no idea what to say to the poor woman.

speaker: Martin
text: Tell her to just go on being herself and her day will come.  [_The doorbell goes_]

speaker: Frasier
text: That must be my muscle.  [_Frasier looks through the security hole_]

speaker: Frasier
text: Dear God it's a woman. Where's my bodyguard when I need him?

speaker: Woman
text: Hello? It's Cindy Carruthers from The Unified Protection Agency.

speaker: Martin
text: Your bodyguard's name is Cindy? What's the matter -- they were all out of Tiffany's?

speaker: Frasier
text: I was expecting someone big and wide like a Dominic, a Rocko, a Ruth even.  [_Frasier opens the door to the woman_]

speaker: Frasier
text: Hello. So glad to see you.

speaker: Cindy
text: Thank you Dr. Crane but you just made a fatal mistake.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh my God it is Kari!

speaker: Cindy
text: No. I mean you should have called The Agency and asked for a description before you let me in. [_Cindy calls her mobile_]

speaker: Cindy
text: Hi Tina. Bring the car around to the service entrance.

speaker: Frasier
text: Tina?

speaker: Martin
text: I guess Candy was busy.

speaker: Cindy
text: First rule for tonight is trust no one you don't know.

speaker: Martin
text: Ooh let me write that down.

speaker: Frasier
text: I suppose you're right. I just start to feel silly when I act paranoid.

speaker: Cindy
text: Don't. Paranoid is good.

speaker: Niles
text: [_proudly_] I was paranoid.

speaker: Cindy
text: Who are these people?

speaker: Frasier
text: [_introducing_] This is my brother Dr. Niles Crane, my father Martin and his home care specialist Daphne Moon.

speaker: Daphne
text: Goodness. You've seen quite a bit of mayhem in your day.

speaker: Cindy
text: Excuse me?

speaker: Daphne
text: Well you see I can sense these things. I'm a bit psychic. Wait, I'm getting a flash now. Did you have a grandfather with a steel plate in his head?

speaker: Cindy
text: [_looking back at Frasier bemused_] This lunatic who's been calling you -- any particular accent?

speaker: Frasier
text: No, No.

speaker: Cindy
text: You have a security system in this place?

speaker: Daphne
text: We don't need a security system. We've got Eddie here. [_Eddie is lying thoroughly bored on the couch_]

speaker: Cindy
text: Hello Eddie. [_Eddie gets up and buries his head under the nearest pillow_]

speaker: Martin
text: Don't let him fool you. You lay a hand on me you'd have a bite on your butt the size of a tennis ball.

speaker: Frasier
text: And Eddie would go for your ankles!

speaker: Daphne
text: My, look at the time. Shouldn't we be going?

speaker: Cindy
text: You'd better let me secure the elevator. Wait here and don't open the door for anyone. By the way Dr. Crane I'll need to know your blood type, location of the nearest trauma centre and a list of any family members who'd be willing to donate organs.

speaker: Niles
text: Just so you know, Frasier, I have unusually small kidneys.  [_The phone goes and Daphne picks it up_]

speaker: Daphne
text: Hello Crane residence��[_puts her hand over the mouthpiece_]�..I think it's her!

speaker: Frasier
text: Niles -- call Cindy. Put it on speaker.  [_Daphne puts the call on speakerphone_]

speaker: Frasier
text: Hello.

speaker: Kari
text: Hi. I know you're in a hurry but I just wanted to let you know I'll be wearing a bright red dress tonight.

speaker: Frasier
text: Kari?

speaker: Kari
text: But don't worry. You won't have to find me -- I'll find you. [_Eddie runs off to the bedrooms_]

speaker: Kari
text: Bye.

speaker: Frasier
text: Kari, wait. [_Kari hangs up_]

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh don't let it bother you so. Come on let's go. Quite frankly I find it hard to imagine -- a woman with such a sweet little voice being dangerous?

speaker: Martin
text: Does the name "Squeaky Fromme" mean anything to you? **THE LADY IN RED**  [_Frasier, Martin, Daphne and Cindy walk in to a large crowded room at the Awards Ceremony_]

speaker: Cindy
text: Alright we're seeing a lot of red dresses here so let's go over some ground rules. Don't go anywhere alone. If you have to go to the men's room go with a "buddy" and keep your back to the wall at all times.

speaker: Martin
text: It's gonna take some marksmanship right there.

speaker: Cindy
text: Don't move but I think I see her. Red dress standing by the bar. She's staring at every man who comes in here but she's hiding her face behind a programme.  [_Frasier looks over but sees it is Roz covering her face (in particular her nose)_]

speaker: Frasier
text: That is my producer Roz. She's harmless. She just has a pimple on her nose. Looks like some kind of biblical plague! [_Frasier goes to bring Roz over to the rest of the group and takes the programme off her._] Roz, Roz. Over here. Oh give me that, will you? You look beautiful. Come join us. [_Roz comes over but now covers her nose with her hand_]

speaker: Cindy
text: Hi, I'm Cindy Carruthers.

speaker: Roz
text: Hi. [_looks over to Martin and Daphne still covering her nose_] Hi

speaker: Daphne & Martin
text: [_both covering their noses_] Hi

speaker: Frasier
text: Stop that! Now Roz, listen, you look terrific. You've done a wonderful little job with your problem there. It's practically disappeared.  [_Bulldog wanders in and sees Roz_]

speaker: Bulldog
text: Whoa Roz. Won't you guide my sleigh tonight?  [_Roz walks off being consoled by Daphne. Bulldog turns to Cindy_]

speaker: Bulldog
text: And who's this lovely lady?

speaker: Cindy
text: Cindy Carruthers.

speaker: Frasier
text: Careful. She has a concealed weapon.

speaker: Bulldog
text: Makes two of us.

speaker: Martin
text: He's not kidding. She's his bodyguard.

speaker: Bulldog
text: Hey. How'd you like to check out a body worth guarding? [_Cindy grabs Bulldog by the neck_]

speaker: Cindy
text: If I move my thumb a quarter of an inch I could kill you.

speaker: Bulldog
text: Whoa! I've never been so turned on in my life. OK let me go. [_Cindy releases Bulldog who's collapsed onto the floor_] So can I call you? [_Bulldog runs off while Niles walks in_]

speaker: Frasier
text: You know I wish this woman would just make her move. I hate this looking over my shoulder thinking it could be anyone.

speaker: Niles
text: At least you know she's wearing a red dress.

speaker: Martin
text: Maybe.

speaker: Niles
text: What do you mean "maybe"?

speaker: Martin
text: [_sarcastic_] Well I'm no professional bodyguard, but if I was a loony tune looking to whack a guy, you know maybe I just wouldn't tell the truth about what I was wearing.

speaker: Cindy
text: No offence to your father but I think you should stick to looking for a woman in a red dress.  [_Daphne walks back in with Roz. Roz's hairstyle is truly hideous with a massive fringe covering one half of her face so completely obscuring her nose. Frasier looks slightly aghast_]

speaker: Daphne
text: Here we are. Good as new.

speaker: Cindy
text: Well should we all head up to the ballroom.

speaker: Frasier
text: All right.

speaker: Roz
text: [_partially blinded by her hair_] Help me! [_Daphne guides her towards the elevator. Frasier takes Niles aside_]

speaker: Frasier
text: Niles, just hear me out on this. Didn't it seem curious to you that Cindy was so quick to dismiss Dad's theory? Cindy who is not wearing a red dress?

speaker: Niles
text: Frasier, you can't think that she's the�

speaker: Frasier
text: Sshhh�.

speaker: Niles
text: Well she couldn't be the�.

speaker: Frasier
text: Sshhh�.

speaker: Niles
text: Well how�.

speaker: Frasier
text: SSHHH. Think about it. She was conveniently out of the apartment at precisely the moment the stalker phoned.

speaker: Niles
text: So she was. And we know she has a cellular phone. That's how she called for the car.

speaker: Frasier
text: What if it is Cindy? Why hasn't she made her move?

speaker: Niles
text: Maybe she's waiting to get you alone.  [_Niles and Frasier move towards the elevator to go up to the ballroom. Niles gets in but the lift is getting crowded. Cindy stops Frasier getting in._]

speaker: Cindy
text: Too many red dresses in there. We'll take our own elevator.  [_Niles and Frasier gasp as Niles tries to reach out to Frasier but the elevator door closes. Frasier looks scared._]

speaker: Cindy
text: Don't be nervous.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, I'm not nervous. I'm just a little chilly. It's a cold night.

speaker: Cindy
text: Should have worn a scarf!

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes I suppose I should have. Believe me I meant to. Honest. [_grabbing for the elevator button_] Where is that elevator?

speaker: Cindy
text: You know I asked for this assignment? Truth is I'm quite a fan of yours. But I guess you figured that out already?

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh my God!

speaker: Cindy
text: What?  [_The elevator door opens. Frasier tries to distract Cindy by pointing at the other side of the room while he dives into the elevator._]

speaker: Frasier
text: There!

speaker: Cindy
text: Where?

speaker: Frasier
text: There behind the bar!  [_Frasier scrambles into the elevator and the doors close behind him. He looks relieved until he hears a voice behind him. It is a woman in a red dress._]

speaker: Woman
text: Frasier Crane? I've been waiting for this moment for a long time. I'm your number one fan.  [_The woman goes to take something out her purse. Before she can Frasier grabs her by an armlock. The elevator door opens to reveal Frasier pinning the woman to the ground. Niles and the others look on in amazement._]

speaker: Frasier
text: Roz, Roz, find Cindy!

speaker: Woman
text: Help me please. Get him off me.

speaker: Roz
text: Frasier are you insane? This is Mrs. Littlejohn -- the Head of the Nominations Committee.  [_Niles looks down at Mrs. Littlejohn who is still being pinned to the ground._]

speaker: Niles
text: Emilia Littlejohn? This is a small world. I know your brother Aubrey!  [_Roz turns to look at Niles in disgust. Roz helps Frasier get Mrs. Littlejohn to her feet and help her out the elevator._]

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh I'm so sorry Mrs. Littlejohn. You see, it's just that, I'm being stalked by this woman named Kari and when you said that you'd been waiting for me I��

speaker: Mrs. L
text: To get an autograph for my niece!

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, well, who's got a pen?  [_Mrs. Littlejohn walks off in disgust._]

speaker: Roz
text: Let's hope we win this year because we're not getting nominated next year!

speaker: Niles
text: Roz, are you doing something different with your hair? [_Roz clouts Niles across the head. Cindy runs up to Frasier._]

speaker: Cindy
text: What happened? Why did you run away from me?

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh I'll tell you what happened. The paranoia has turned me into a crazy person. First I though you were the stalker. Then I thought she was the stalker [_pointing towards Mrs. Littlejohn_] You know I've had enough of this. I'm gonna confront this thing face to face.  [_Frasier walks towards the elevator and gets in_]

speaker: Frasier
text: [_practically shouting_] Everyone! I will be in the lobby.

speaker: Martin
text: Frasier calm down

speaker: Frasier
text: I WILL BE IN THE LOBBY!  [_Martin notices a woman sitting on a sofa wearing a red dress and a "bizarre" purple and white scarf._]

speaker: Martin
text: You're Kari aren't you?

speaker: Kari
text: How did you know?

speaker: Martin
text: You made a scarf just like that for Frasier. He's my son.

speaker: Kari
text: I think there's been a big misunderstanding. I'm just a fan. I never meant to frighten him.

speaker: Martin
text: Well what about that note -- about the last guy who didn't wear the scarf ended up in his grave?

speaker: Kari
text: That was my husband Walter. He caught pneumonia. I won't bother your son anymore. Could you just tell him what happened?

speaker: Martin
text: I'll be glad to explain and, if I'm lucky, he won't understand and I'll have to explain all over again.

speaker: Kari
text: I'm sure he'll understand. That's the one thing about your son Mr. Crane -- he's so smart and level-headed. [_Kari walks off._]

speaker: Martin
text: [_to himself_] What's she been smoking?  [_Frasier's elevator opens out onto the lobby which is empty._]

speaker: Frasier
text: Well I'm here -- you demented harpy. Come and get me.  [_Frasier hears a door and looks to the other side of the room to see a someone leaving._]

speaker: Frasier
text: Kari?  [_Frasier follows through the door and ends up down in the parking lot. He can't see anyone else._]

speaker: Frasier
text: Alright I know you're down here. Come on out and face me! Not so brave any more, huh? You think you're tough but you're only tough as long as you're hiding in the shadows. You wanna see who's really tough? You just come on out here!  [_From behind a parked van three rather big, rather burly men walk out and stare at Frasier. Frasier is taken aback._]

speaker: Frasier
text: When I said "tough" I was speaking clearly in a rhetorical sense.  [_The three men start to walk towards Frasier as Frasier starts to walk backwards._]

speaker: Frasier
text: Would�er�any of you happen to have the time�.[_Frasier takes off his watch and offers it to the men_]�..would any of you like the time?  [_Frasier turns and makes a run for the stairs back up to the Awards Ceremony whilst being chased_]
